answers.answer: Diabetes is a progressive disease. I would suggest you consult with the physician or RN managing your care and discuss adjustments to your insulin.
Illness can raise BG so can infectionsWhat do YOU call a propper diet?carbohydrates raise BG, whole wheat, brown rice, potatoes  all raise BG

Check your meter. It could be that if you dropped it or left it in a hot car, it is now defective. They usually are only good for 2-3 years, too. Run a test on the meter with the sugar glucose fluid you have and a fresh test strip. If it is out of range, it could be the meter. Ask your doctor for a new one.

question: Why would my blood sugar be high if I'm eating a proper diet?  Its been a steady 155 ALL DAY... I'm not eating anything and I've taken my insulin, so why is it so high?
title: high meter reading
